results.title: Safety of preoperative carvedilol in a patient with recent atenolol-induced pheochromocytoma crisis and cardiomyopathy: A case report
results.text_hl: The present case illustrates the onset of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ crisis and @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011654 @@@pulmonary edema@@@ after the administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, a @GENE_MS4A1 @GENE_931 @@@beta1@@@-antagonist, during a 12-h period without previous administration of alpha-adrenergic blocker.

citations.NLM: Wannachalee T, Chunharojrith P. Safety of preoperative carvedilol in a patient with recent atenolol-induced pheochromocytoma crisis and cardiomyopathy: A case report Ann Med Surg (Lond). 2020 Dec;60():360-364. PMID: 33224491
citations.BibTeX: @article{33224491, title={Safety of preoperative carvedilol in a patient with recent atenolol-induced pheochromocytoma crisis and cardiomyopathy: A case report}, author={Wannachalee T and Chunharojrith P}, journal={Ann Med Surg (Lond)}, volume={60}, pages={360-364}}

results.title: [Acute respiratory distress syndrome in a patient treated with atenolol].
results.text_hl: According to the different criteria which are generally used, the diagnosis of @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011654 @@@pulmonary oedema@@@ induced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ was made.

citations.NLM: Guilaumé B, Moualla M, Bugnon D, Clémenti E, Berruchon J. [Acute respiratory distress syndrome in a patient treated with atenolol]. Rev Mal Respir. 1998 Sep;15(4):541-3. PMID: 9805766
citations.BibTeX: @article{9805766, title={[Acute respiratory distress syndrome in a patient treated with atenolol].}, author={Guilaumé B and Moualla M and Bugnon D and Clémenti E and Berruchon J}, journal={Rev Mal Respir}, volume={15}, number={4}, pages={541-3}}

results.title: Beta-adrenergic antagonists improve oxygen saturation in acute pulmonary edema: a case series in the prehospital setting.
results.text_hl: In this case series, we report the use of intravenous @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, a short-acting cardioselective beta-adrenergic antagonist, to treat @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011654 @@@acute pulmonary edema@@@ in the prehospital setting.

citations.NLM: Bertini P, Ferro B, Baldassarri R, Genovesi F, Guarracino F. Beta-adrenergic antagonists improve oxygen saturation in acute pulmonary edema: a case series in the prehospital setting. Prehosp Emerg Care. 2013 Jul-Sep;17(3):421-3. PMID: 23607890
citations.BibTeX: @article{23607890, title={Beta-adrenergic antagonists improve oxygen saturation in acute pulmonary edema: a case series in the prehospital setting.}, author={Bertini P and Ferro B and Baldassarri R and Genovesi F and Guarracino F}, journal={Prehosp Emerg Care}, volume={17}, number={3}, pages={421-3}}

results.title: Short-term effects of early intravenous treatment with a beta-adrenergic blocking agent or a specific bradycardiac agent in patients with acute myocardial infarction receiving thrombolytic therapy.
results.text_hl: No significant differences in clinical events were observed, with the exception of a greater incidence of nonfatal @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011654 @@@pulmonary edema@@@ in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group (6% vs. 1% in the @CHEMICAL_alinidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C022192 @@@alinidine@@@ group and 0% in the placebo group, p = 0.021).

citations.NLM: Van de Werf F, Janssens L, Brzostek T, Mortelmans L, Wackers FJ, Willems GM, Heidbüchel H, Lesaffre E, Scheys I, Collen D. Short-term effects of early intravenous treatment with a beta-adrenergic blocking agent or a specific bradycardiac agent in patients with acute myocardial infarction receiving thrombolytic therapy. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1993 Aug;22(2):407-16. PMID: 8335810
citations.BibTeX: @article{8335810, title={Short-term effects of early intravenous treatment with a beta-adrenergic blocking agent or a specific bradycardiac agent in patients with acute myocardial infarction receiving thrombolytic therapy.}, author={Van de Werf F and Janssens L and Brzostek T and Mortelmans L and Wackers FJ and Willems GM and Heidbüchel H and Lesaffre E and Scheys I and Collen D}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={22}, number={2}, pages={407-16}}
